Summary Design Engineer with substantial experience in all aspects of IC Verification and Validation. Interested in a challenging position that best engages my analytical skills offering opportunities in hardware design, embedded software development, DSP and VLSI design. Specialties:Pre-si Verification in verilog using coverage-driven random testing 
Post-si Validation using various high-level languages, like C++, VC++ and MFC 
Software Automation using Labview and other scripting languages

Expertise in software/hardware and board-level debug using creative approach to problem solving Experience Graphics Software Applications Engineer Intel Corporation September 2010  – Present (5 years) Verification Engineer Intel June 2008  –  March 2009  (10 months) Worked for the Ultra-Mobility Group for their flagship product used in Mobile Internet devices. Conducted various IC design verification functions including interpretation of architecture specifications and design models, development of verification environment, creation of test plans and test methods; execution of tests, following with result analysis and debug. Responsible for creating and executing functional verification coverage requirements using random testbench covering all possible test scenarios and sequences. Worked across multiple sites with a multi-disciplinary team to help deliver a quality, error-free product. Design Engineer KeyEye Communications June 2005  –  April 2008  (2 years 11 months) Responsibilities included pre-silicon verification, software development, automation, post-silicon validation and debug using coverage-driven random testing 
 
Software development 
Developed production software for the 10 Gbps Ethernet transceiver. Responsible for the power-on, reset and debug sequences. Experience in the full cycle of software design process including requirements definition, prototyping, proof of concept, design, interface implementation, testing and maintenance for the debug software used for evaluating the chip. 
 
Design and Pre-silicon Verification: 
Designed verilog test benches for all blocks in the Analog Front End and simulated them using Modelsim. Verified different modes of operation at the unit and cluster levels.  
 
Labview and Automation: 
Developed fully automated test benches, using Labview, TCL and C++, for analyzing the performance of DAC and the ADC at various voltage, frequency and temperature settings. Automation suite controlled Vector Network Analyzer, Spectrum analyzer & thermonics for data collection. Matlab and Perl scripts were used to post-process the data and analyze hardware performance.  
 
Developed automated test suite that simulated the XAUI interface, using Labview, TCL and Spirent traffic generator.  
 
Post-silicon validation and Debug:  
Responsible for writing software in VC++ using MFC to test transceivers. Added TCL extensions and capabilities to detect hardware error conditions.  
 
Responsible for power-on debug, which involved validating the power-on sequence for the chip and fixing board level issues. Debug also included waveform captures to root cause bugs using scopes. Oversee outshore product development and provide valuable interface between the client base and IT headquarters in India Research Assistant University of New Mexico August 2002  –  December 2003  (1 year 5 months) Image and Video Processing and Communbication Lab (ivPCL), UNM 
Projects on Ultrasound imaging, 3D multirate imaging, Lossy and Lossless compression techniques for analyzing images. Work was done using Matlab and automated with Unix shell scripts Teaching Assistant University of New Mexico August 2001  –  May 2002  (10 months) Taught in classroom and on web course (EECE 238, Digital Logic Design). Work included regular lectures, supervision of lab sections, and open office hours. Assessed grading of students Research Assistant - Intern Kestrel Corporation August 2000  –  May 2001  (10 months) Worked with a team, in developing a Computer Aided Diagnostic (CAD) system for use in several imaging applications. Research was supported by the National Institute of Occupational Safety and Health. Summary Excellent skill set as a Senior Systems Engineer/Technologist with 14 years’ experience in administrating, developing and managing enterprise virtual and physical environments, Outstanding understanding and experience with SaaS, PaaS, IaaS, VMware, OpenStack, Software Defined Networking, Windows/Linux servers, application development, scripting, coding automation solutions, web creation, database systems, network technologies, server storage, server hardware, Active Directory, backup/restore systems, server security. Skills also include excellent leadership, problem shoving and technical experience in a global enterprise environment with 100,000 users and over 20,000 servers. Partners extremely well across multiple organizations and strives to be the subject matter expert in all needed areas. Experience Open Network Platform Software Applications Engineer Intel Corporation June 2014  – Present (1 year 3 months) Restructuring the Intel ONPs to support multiple OEMs. This includes redesigning the ONPs, and Open Network Software (ONS), developing and improving the performance and easiness of incorporating the technologies with our OEMs.  
 
Streamlining the process of development, testing and delivery of the ONPs & ONS internally. The streamlining includes redesigning the installation procedure on OEMs products to ease.  
 
Defining and designing the ONPs & ONS interfaces to increase the engagement of third-party SDN & NFV application vendors with Intel products.  
 
Engaging TEMs, OEMs, IHVs, and ISVs within the market ecosystem to enable them to design their solutions and go to market on the Intel ONP Server and Switch Reference Designs for Telecom, Cloud and Enterprise. 
 
Owning and managing design-in support from initial customer opportunity discovery to end product qualification and debugging for the Intel ONP Reference Designs and their system-level ingredients (software, processors, chipsets, switch, NIC).  
 
Supporting sales and marketing teams to engage with customers on technical solutions that best fulfill their requirements.  
 
Working directly with architects and engineering to ensure a complete platform solution is defined and enabled for Intel's customers to use during their development cycle.  
 
Owning and driving the definition and development of platform technical documentation for Intel's customers. This will also require direct engagement with product marketing to develop customer-ready collateral and messages.  
 
Training and enabling field sales teams to achieve design wins on ONP as reference architecture for Intel products and solutions.  
Partnering closely with peer silicon and software PAE teams within CSIG (ND, CID, SD) to deliver a single point of contact to OEMs to ensure end to end technical support across the platform.  
 
Navigating ambiguous and dynamic SDN/NFV market environments to drive program clarity and design win focus on Intel ONP Senior Cloud Engineer Intel Corporation February 2009  –  June 2014  (5 years 5 months) HIllsboro, OR Lead engineer for enterprise wide Virtualization Factory inclusive of standard P2Vs (Physical to Virtual Migration) as well as highly complex, large, white glove conversion projects. Inclusive of all engineering, testing, and implementation of the P2V and V2V (virtual to virtual) process, both technical and process related.  
 
Leader for cloud team that accomplished one of the most critical CIO's goals which was reaching a share of market of 90% virtual servers in Intel’s data centers. Rick leadership and technical skills including the P2V/V2V/Cloning/Migration efforts were a huge factor that enabled the cloud team to reach IT’s goal. Over 10,000 physical servers were converted to virtual as a result in 12 major datacenters worldwide. 
 
Lead project for DMZ/Secure P2V conversions. The scope of this project was much larger than for internal due to additional technical complexity. Rick tested/configured/documented/created BKMs/trained and lead the effort to successfully complete the project on time with no issue. This effort was key in allowing the cloud team to achieve IT Staff’s goal of 80% of all DMZ servers going virtual. 
 
OpenStack development and automation technical lead. OpenStack expert including expert knowledge of Nova/Glance (Compute), Neutron (networking), Swift/Cindar/Ceph (storage). Automation solutions for self vm provisioning, issue management/tracking, hundreds of hours of time savings via script automation. 
 
Managed enterprise VMware virtual server production environment consisting of over 300 physical servers and 13,000 virtual servers 
 
Point of contact for all cloud factory related direction, strategy, budget, hardware purchases, hiring, coaching, training, documentation, project management, program lead, and decider.  
 
Subject matter expert for IT@Intel and presented multiple knowledge sharing sessions in over 20 cities for internal/external customers related to Intel’s Cloud Program and Intel Technical Summits. Senior System Engineer Intel Corporation August 2005  –  February 2009  (3 years 7 months) Hillsboro, OR Lead senior system engineer for over 25 mission critical Tier 1 applications consisting of 89 physical servers in 9 geos. Responsibilities included server landings/purchase, hardware maintenance, proactive maintenance, automation, server security, OS health and configuration, SQL engineering and configuration, IIS build and configuration. Partnered with all developers, application owners and management to ensure applications were running at highest level of efficiency.  
 
Ensured all environments remained compliant with corporate security, engineering new technical solutions, disaster recovery, SAN/NAS setup, SQL cluster solutions, Window Server Web farms while insuring the environment had the utmost uptime for the over 20,000 users of multiple Tier 1 application that consisted of 105 production servers located in 12 international and domestic sites. Analyzed the high number of incidents being escalated to the development and infrastructure team and then drove an alert reduction effort to dramatically reduce the number of escalation by 85%. 
 
Led the implementation of SOX controls on multiple legal environments and implemented key security to the production servers per SOX requirements within the schedule provided. 
 
End to end enterprise lead for EAE team for the LAMBS (Level 1, Asset, Monitoring, Backup, SRS (Site Operations)) project. In this role Rick drove to standardize monitoring, accessibility, reliability and information for the first level support for over 429 EAE servers.  
 
Senior Engineering team lead for the KTBR’s first VMware pilot. Pilot tested VMware with is virtualization software to enable multiple servers to be consolidated on 1 server platform. Enabled IT to consolidate hundreds of servers that were very underutilized. Rick partnered with the NGCI team to create all VMware documentation and has become the baseline throughout IT System Engineer Intel Corporation August 2000  –  August 2005  (5 years 1 month) Hillsboro,, OR Server Standard Team lead which included gathering the majority of requirements and developing the server audit tool, server uptime tool, disk space management tool and standardizing automation toolbox.  
 
Longhorn V-team – First to test Longhorn for enterprise release. Completed and successfully tested on multiple applications on Longhorn and gave his feedback and results to the Longhorn v-team. Longhorn testing and POC resulted in ability to more quickly migrate multiple applications to Longhorn and give training to teammates. Partnered with Microsoft to better work out issues with Longhorn and ultimately make the OS better for end users. 
 
Server RFP Project –This project resulted in the standard process to decide which hardware vendor Intel will use for all server purchases. Responsibilities included attending weekly meetings, giving options on server vendor hardware, rank the vendors that are in scope for the project, give vendors server requirements as well as maintenance requirements.  
 
MAX server system engineer – Managed critical tier 1 MAX application which consisted of 34 servers in 8 different geos. Server automation, security, hardware testing/purchasing, application development, SQL migration and 24/7 support were all key factors in the success of MAX engineering.  
 
Lead engineer and original MOM monitoring core team member for all enterprise MOM monitoring releases. Duties included attending all core meetings, testing all rules, giving feedback to v-team, and validating the rollout of the release. Submitted new rules for creation that enabled system engineers to better monitor their servers allowing system engineers to configure their MOM rules 85% faster and with less issues in the server registry. Also attended Core Team meetings, the SMA core team meetings and the SMA deployment forum.
